lexUnit.name: drizzle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: light rain falling in very fine drops.

sentence.text: Scotland and Northern Ireland will be cloudy with patchy drizzle in the west , but there will be sunny intervals , particularly in the east .
Tomorrow morning will be mild , with rain or drizzle in places , but heavier rain will move quickly across the region in the morning .
She thought of joining Chelsea Art School and learning to paint , she timidly told Toby one evening , as they hurried through a drizzle to the Markham Arms .
LONDON had a little drizzle on the evening of 28 April 1981 .
We climbed into the clouds and a cooling drizzle began to fall .
As she staggered out , hardly visible under boxes and plastic bags , into Oxford Street and a freezing drizzle , she cast a jaundiced eye at the Christmas decorations .
After lunch we explored Cambridge , mindless of the cold drizzle , appreciating the contrast of mellow stone pitched against a pencilled sky .
The fine drizzle that has been falling all afternoon has not been enough to stop the match between Scotland and Ireland , but enough to keep the crowds away .
Fine drizzles and thin smokes of cloud particles can reach the Cytherean surface .
Usually she cries like the rain we had on a holiday once , up in Scotland -- a soft , grey drizzle -- but this time her body shook with real sobs .
It started to rain again , a light drizzle that caused umbrellas to pop up all over the place .
Kapil had a frustrating day yesterday as a light drizzle washed out the fourth day 's play in India 's first Test against South Africa in Durban .
Tomorrow morning will be mostly dry , with any thicker cloud in the east of the region and only light rain or drizzle over the Cotswolds .
More useful than the rainstorms has been the steady drizzle over the past few weeks .
She had got soaked to the skin in the steady London drizzle and at the first kind words of sympathy from her friend , her emotions had bubbled to the surface .
The meteorologists would prove to be right about the sun , but as if to prove their fallibility at four eleven a steady drizzle began .
Drizzle was falling again , and she saw two RIC policemen patrolling past , their capes gleaming .
The drizzle fell steadily , dribbling across the pock-marked tarmac , forcing forlorn figures at bus-stops to huddle together even closer under the shelters .
